page.title: 20Population of the area.
page.content: Figures taken from the 1981 census. This area is part of the Borough of Islwyn, which has a total population of 65,929. The area has three main districts, Cefn Fforest, Blackwood and Pontllanfraith. Cefn Fforest is an old village, which consists mainly of old houses. Its population is 3,278. Blackwood district includes the largest town in the area ,and there has been a number of new estates built,Park Hill, Bonnie View and Grove Park.As a result its young population has steadily risen to 6,919. Pontllanfraith is a fairly old village,but new estates like Springfield and Penllwyn have been added.The population is again mainly young,and totals 8,246.
